intro: Muxiria utilis, commonly known as the useful marsh plant, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Due to its adaptability, it plays an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
